column4: hello I recently changed my router ip and now my apache vhosts aren't working.. anybody have any ideas?
the webserver still works it's just that my vhosts just take me to default
what version of apace?
do you have the IP defined in /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/*
something that looks like NameVirtualHost and/or  VirtualHost?
you should probably check out the logs too: /var/log/apache2/error.log
by default vhosts are usually in /etc/apache2/sites-available/default
if you specified an IP in the config instead of *.80
if you specified an IP in the config instead of *:80
no i just specified the hostname
can you reach it internally?
no
just takes me to the default
where is the vhost defined?
in /etc/apache2/sites-available
and is enabled using a2ensite sitename
i run ubuntu 10.10
You have NameVirtualHost *:80 and <VirtualHost *:80> defined?
yeah
i do now but i had it deleted
when i put namevirtual host i get NameVirtualHost *:80 has no VirtualHosts
after NameVirtualHost there should be <VirtualHost *:80>,
